dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, remember Reed Hastings, the big dog at Netflix, when all these new streaming services were popping up? He was, like, totally dismissing them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, remember Reed Hastings, the big dog at Netflix, when all these new streaming services were popping up? He was, like, totally dismissing them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, I totally remember that! He called them "amateur hour brands," right? Said they'd just be a drain on consumers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I totally remember that! He called them amateur hour brands, right? Said they'd just be a drain on consumers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big dog of Internet TV acknowledged the new competitors as world-class consumer brands whose forthcoming services would be a boon to consumers and content creators alike.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But then, um, the article makes it pretty clear he couldn't actually hide his rising panic. He basically admitted these new entrants *would* materially affect their growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But then, um, the article makes it pretty clear he couldn't actually hide his rising panic. He basically admitted these new entrants would materially affect their growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then the numbers dropped, and it was, uh, pretty stark. A huge loss of 9.6 million subscribers in that quarter ending March.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then the numbers dropped, and it was, uh, pretty stark. A huge loss of nine point six million subscribers in that quarter ending March.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the vast majority, like, 7.86 million, were from within the US! That's, that's their home turf.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the vast majority, like, seven point eight six million, were from within the U S! That's, that's their home turf.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then, weirdly, they forecast soaring growth for the next quarter. Which made the stock jump almost five bucks a share.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, weirdly, they forecast soaring growth for the next quarter. Which made the stock jump almost five bucks a share.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, that part confused me! How do you lose that many, then suddenly predict a bounce back? And revenue was *down* 22% year-over-year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that part confused me! How do you lose that many, then suddenly predict a bounce back? And revenue was down twenty two percent year-over-year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Revenue for the first quarter rose 22% to $4.5 billion, compared with a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And all this, mind you, was *before* Disney unveiled Disney+, which, like, everyone knows caused a stock market crash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this, mind you, was before Disney unveiled Disney+, which, like, everyone knows caused a stock market crash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported its earnings a week after Disney saw a favorable stock market bump following the unveiling of its Disney+ service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so then Hastings kinda pivoted, saying there's, uh, "very little appetite for movies and TV shows" and that Netflix had "saturated that demand."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so then Hastings kinda pivoted, saying there's, uh, very little appetite for movies and T V shows and that Netflix had saturated that demand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He argued that theres ample appetite for great movies and TV shows, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And he even said, "there's barely any competition out there," like Disney and Apple add nothing. Talk about, uh, denial.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And he even said, there's barely any competition out there, like Disney and Apple add nothing. Talk about, uh, denial.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Theres a ton of competition out there, Hastings said in a recorded interview following the earnings release. Disney and apple add a little bit more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, almost in the same breath, he's downplaying their own big original content. Like *The Umbrella Academy*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, almost in the same breath, he's downplaying their own big original content. Like The Umbrella Academy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the face of mounting competition, Hastings touted the strength of Netflix's original content. The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, he conceded it was watched by "just" 45 million households. Like that's not a lot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, he conceded it was watched by just forty five million households. Like that's not a lot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the face of mounting competition, Hastings touted the strength of Netflix's original content. The Umbrella Academy... has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, *Triple Frontier*, the Ben Affleck movie? He said "viewers in a mere 52 million homes avoided" it. That's a pretty specific way to put it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, Triple Frontier, the Ben Affleck movie? He said viewers in a mere fifty two million homes avoided it. That's a pretty specific way to put it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier, starring Ben Affleck and directed by J.C. Chandor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just, like, the big US originals. They started canceling international shows too, didn't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just, like, the big U S originals. They started canceling international shows too, didn't they?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like *Nailed It! Mexico*. Canceled because it got three times *less* first-month watchers than the dubbed US version.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like Nailed It! Mexico. Canceled because it got three times less first-month watchers than the dubbed U S version.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ¡Nailed It!: México has achieved three times more first-month watchers in Mexico than the dubbed US version, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And *Kingdom*, their big Korean zombie series? Hastings called it their "least successful season one show in Korea to date."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Kingdom, their big Korean zombie series? Hastings called it their least successful season one show in Korea to date.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This period piece with zombies is our most successful season one show in Korea to date and has also been watched by millions of members outside of Korea, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is why Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos just drops the bomb that the bottom ten shows...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is why Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos just drops the bomb that the bottom ten shows...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: ...are all Netflix original brands. Just, uh, *ouch*. Big oof right there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...are all Netflix original brands. Just, uh, ouch. Big oof right there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos.
